etymologies: Middle English: of Germanic origin; related to Dutch stelt and German Stelze. stilt (sense 2) dates from the late 18th century

definitions: either of a pair of upright poles with supports for the feet enabling the user to walk at a distance above the ground.
shortDefinitions: either of pair of upright poles with supports for feet

definitions: each of a set of posts or piles supporting a building above the ground.
shortDefinitions: each of set of posts or piles supporting building

definitions: a small, flat, three-pointed support for ceramic ware in a kiln.
shortDefinitions: small, flat, three-pointed support for ceramic ware in kiln

definitions: a long-billed wading bird with predominantly black and white plumage and long slender reddish legs.

notes.text: Family Recurvirostridae: two genera, in particular Himantopus, and several species

shortDefinitions: long-billed wading bird with predominantly black and white plumage
